title: Implement custom cohort creation and saving
summary: Enable users to define, create, and persist custom cohorts for analysis, supporting flexible inclusion criteria and reusable cohort definitions. Provides foundational capability for advanced cohort analytics within the SaaS platform.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: perform cohort analysis with time-decaying weighting for user retention metrics; users can create and auto-update custom cohorts

title: Enable auto-updating of cohorts as new users match criteria
summary: Automatically update cohort membership to include users who newly satisfy the cohort criteria, ensuring cohort composition stays current without manual intervention.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Users can create and auto-update custom cohorts based on signup date, product usage events, or milestones

title: Apply time-decay weighting to retention and activity metrics
summary: Integrate time-decaying weighting functions into retention and activity metrics, allowing recent events to have greater analytical influence and enabling more nuanced analysis of user engagement trends.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Retention/activity metrics should support adjustable time-decay functions (e.g., exponential, linear)

low_confidence_reason: Weighting as a tag is not standard; inference based on context.

title: Provide adjustable decay function selection (exponential, linear) in settings
summary: Allow users to choose and configure decay weighting functions, such as exponential or linear, directly within application settings to tailor retention metrics to their analysis preferences.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Retention/activity metrics should support adjustable time-decay functions...with UI controls for function selection.

title: Develop visualizations including trend lines and cohort heatmaps
summary: Create interactive visualizations that display user retention and activity trends, including trend lines and cohort heatmaps, to allow in-depth analysis of cohort behavior over time.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Visualizations must include trend lines and heatmaps, supporting overlay of standard vs. time-decayed metrics

title: Allow overlay of standard and time-decayed metrics in visualizations
summary: Support visualization overlays to compare traditional metrics with their time-decayed counterparts on the same chart, enhancing interpretability and comparative analysis for end users.

title: Support export of cohort analysis to CSV and PDF formats
summary: Enable users to export cohort analysis data and visualizations in industry-standard formats (CSV, PDF) for reporting, sharing, and further offline analysis.

title: Handle duplicate cohort membership for users in overlapping cohorts
summary: Ensure correct handling of users present in multiple overlapping cohorts, preventing double-counting or logic errors in retention and activity calculations.

title: Prompt user to adjust if decay parameters cause zeroed metrics
summary: Provide proactive user prompts when decay settings result in all metrics being zero, guiding users to reconfigure parameters for meaningful results.

title: Provide help article explaining cohort logic and decay weighting
summary: Deliver documentation detailing cohort formation logic, the application of decay weighting in metrics, and best practices for utilizing these features effectively within SaaS analytics.
